title: Raymond James’ Recruiting Push Pays Off
text:
Text size

When Raymond James reported earnings last week, it noted its advisor headcount topped 8,000, setting a record.

The firm has been recruiting aggressively, FinancialPlanning reports, and has been doling out recruiting loans as it hunts for new talent.

Its tally of advisors could grow again when it next reports results. CEO Paul Reilly said in an earnings call that he expects more large teams and advisors to join in coming months, according to the publication.

“I can’t remember seeing so many $5 million to $10 million [advisors] in the pipeline,” he was quoted saying.

The St. Petersburg, Florida-based firm said it had 8,011 advisors at the end of September, up a net 107 from the end of June and up a net 198 from the end of September 2018.

The recruiting loans certainly can’t hurt. But industry recruiter Mark Elzweig told FinancialPlanning that Raymond James’ big draw is its emphasis on advisors owning the client relationship: “It’s worth noting that while they do offer a deal, it’s not why they attract advisors.”

--Ross Snel
description: When the firm reported earnings last week, it said its advisor headcount hit a record 8,011.
